metadata.titel_preek: The Enemy Lines Are Hard to Find

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God overcomes the universal human condition of disobedience and self-deception by identifying with the ungodly through Christ's death to bestow mercy on all.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has consigned all men to disobedience, that he may have mercy upon all
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies
that he may have mercy upon all
that he might bring us to God

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Plan
tekstueel_bewijs: It is God’s plan to have mercy upon us

ontvanger.identificatie: The Ungodly / All Humanity (including the hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: salvation of each and every one of us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly placed in the position of the Receiver/Ungodly, not the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Gospel / The Season of Lent / Insight
tekstueel_bewijs: We make our confessions in the secure embrace of the gospel
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper who 'enters our condition'.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the source of 'insight' and 'liberation'.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Line' in the human heart / Self-righteousness / Sin / Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the line separating good and evil passes... right through every human heart
human vengefulness, indifference, cruelty, and hate
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but a 'consignment to disobedience' and a 'murderous impulse' that requires a divine death to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and the refusal to demonize the 'other'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Christian Community
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human repentance is presented as a response to the 'secure embrace of the gospel' (Primary Program).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has consigned all human beings
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies
God sees you as you really are and he loves you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We relish looking at the evil of others

voorbeelden: the Christian will beware lest more evil deeds begin to erupt
When we are unable to utter a sincere apology...
The Bible teaches us to see ourselves as God sees us
While we were still helpless, Christ died

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'helplessness' (lack of Pouvoir) which is met by God's 'mercy' (bestowal of Pouvoir/liberation). Repentance is framed as 'insight' (Savoir) rather than a work (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false S1 (thinking we are 'good') to the reality of S2 (the line in the heart), then through ~S2 (insight/repentance) to the true S1 (God's mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christ being 'numbered among the transgressors'—taking S2 to give S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as a 'consignment' and 'murderous impulses'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the hearer as 'helpless' and 'ungodly' and makes God the sole agent of salvation. Moral effort is replaced by 'insight' into one's need for mercy.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Our two greatest presidents... both called the nation to repentance.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: With the last breath of his body... he has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
The line separating good and evil passes... right through every human heart.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as models; rather, contemporary and historical figures are used to illustrate the universal failure of the human heart.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Humility and liberation; relief from the need to maintain a 'good' facade.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is entirely God's work for the 'helpless'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative flows perfectly from the human problem (the blurred line) to the divine solution (the cross).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the righteous for the unrighteous, that he might bring us to God

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the work of the Son, with the Spirit's work implied in the 'insight' of repentance.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an inescapable 'consignment' that affects even the 'best of hearts'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. The hearer is never asked to save themselves or even to 'improve' themselves to earn mercy.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's power to save).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The definition of repentance as 'insight' is brilliant for bypassing moralistic 'devoir'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (sin/the line) is already sufficiently intensified.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's mercy) clearly grounds the Ethics (not judging others).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It uses the 'blurred line' not to excuse sin, but to level the ground at the foot of the cross.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the effective use of the Tolkien and Solzhenitsyn anecdotes; Greimas shows these anecdotes function to strip the hearer of 'Subject' status in the salvation story.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain Romans 5:6; Greimas shows how the sermon's structure actually embodies the 'helplessness' Paul describes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—moving from the human 'I judge' to the divine 'I have mercy'.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'if/then' trap of moralism.
